messages.content:
If you are one of the 5,063 who voted UKIP here in Wallasey in 2015, then I’d like to say ‘thank you’.
You may think it’s a bit odd for a candidate from another Party to thank you for voting. But, partly due to the work of UKIP in the past, our country was finally given a referendum.
In that campaign, I worked hard for the Vote Leave team. In that referendum, many Conservative and UKIP supporters came together, along with supporters from other parties, to achieve the result our country needed.
Now, it is time for UKIP supporters to make their votes count again. Here in the Wallasey Constituency, Jeremy Corbyn’s candidate stands for neither Brexit nor Labour is, at best, weak, and has now delayed Brexit.
A vote for UKIP this time will only help Jeremy Corbyn’s candidate to win again. I am writing to ask you to go with your vote instead.
I’m not a career politician. I’m a dad of four who has lived in the real world, I worked as a builder and I am a big believer that Parliament needs more people who live in the real world.
If elected as your new MP on Thursday 8th June, I will work with Theresa May to make a success of Brexit so that Britain will, once again, have control over immigration.
At the same time, we will be free to pursue trade with European markets, and secure new trade agreements with other countries.
I am also committed to improving our NHS, schools and public services. It’s only by having a strong and stable economy that we will generate the money needed to pay for this investment.
At this election, it’s a choice between me, Theresa May’s candidate in Wallasey, or Jeremy Corbyn’s candidate. UKIP is too far behind and can’t win here.
Yours sincerely
Andy Livsey
Andy Livsey
Theresa May’s Conservative Candidate
P.S. If you need any information about where and when to vote, call the Elections Unit at the Town Hall on 691 8046.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Requiring non-EU migrants to pay more to use our NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: 7 out of 10 voters backed this policy too. Andy Livsey needs your vote to make it happen.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Reducing net migration into the UK
keyPolicies.policyDescription: 56% of all voters, including Labour voters, backed this policy. Andy Livsey needs your vote to make it happen.
